{{cpp/keyword/title|{{tt|struct}}}}
{{cpp/keyword/navbar}}

===Usage===
* [[cpp/language/class|declaration of a compound type]]
{{rrev|since=c++11|
* [[cpp/language/enum|declaration of a scoped enumeration type]]
}}
* If a function or a variable exists in scope with the name identical to the name of a non-union class type, {{tt|struct}} can be prepended to the name for disambiguation, resulting in an [[cpp/language/elaborated type specifier|elaborated type specifier]].

===Example===
{{example
|code=
struct Foo; // forward declaration of a struct

struct Bar  // definition of a struct
{
    Bar(int i) : i(i + i) {}

    int i;
};

enum struct Pub // scoped enum, since C++11
{
    b, d, p, q,
};

int main()
{
    Bar Bar(1);
    struct Bar Bar2(2); // elaborated type
}
}}
